title: Leading Hydroelectric Power Producer
description: In 2021, Bhutan generated 99.99% of its electricity from hydroelectric sources, making it one of the top countries in the world for hydroelectric power production.

title: 100% Renewable Electricity Output
description: As of 2021, Bhutan achieved a remarkable milestone by producing 100% of its electricity from renewable sources.

title: Minimal Informal Payments to Public Officials
description: In 2015, only 0.1% of firms in Bhutan reported making informal payments to public officials, showcasing a transparent business environment.

title: Quick Licensing Process for Businesses
description: In 2015, it took just 1.2 days on average to obtain an operating license in Bhutan, reflecting an efficient regulatory environment.

title: High Merchandise Trade with South Asia
description: In 2023, 95.89% of Bhutan's merchandise exports and 91.50% of imports were with low- and middle-income economies in South Asia.

title: High External Debt Relative to Exports
description: In 2023, Bhutan's external debt was 332.14% of its exports of goods, services, and primary income, indicating a significant debt burden.

title: Significant Use of IMF Credit
description: In 2023, Bhutan utilized $34.27 million in IMF credit, highlighting reliance on international financial support.

title: Limited Intellectual Property Receipts
description: In 2024, Bhutan had a negative balance of $8,581.42 in charges for the use of intellectual property, indicating low revenue from this sector.

title: High Time Spent on Government Regulations
description: In 2015, senior management in Bhutan spent 28.8% of their time dealing with government regulations, suggesting a bureaucratic challenge.
